ch.unizh.ori.nabu.ui.http
Class SubsFilter

java.lang.Object
  ch.unizh.ori.nabu.ui.http.SubsFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.servlet.Filter
public class SubsFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.servlet.Filter

The SubsFilter handles branching into the different subs as well as authentication, authorization and SSL redirection. Every request to Nabu has to pass here by. For authentication configuration see init(FilterConfig). For the actions performed on the request see doFilter(ServletRequest, javax.servlet.ServletResponse, javax.servlet.FilterChain). A word on LDAP/UniAccess authentication: This is done in this class using DirContext, by binding the user with the login password to uid=<username>,ou=People,ou=UniAccess,ou=zi,dc=unizh,dc=ch on server ldap://ldap.uzh.ch:389/. If binding is ok, the password is correct, else it's not. For debugging purposes, if a parameter debugAuth=1 is added to any url, a 401 error is returned, so that the browser asks again for a password. This can be used to give a new username, which is else only possible by restarting the browser.

Author:
pht
See Also:
doFilter(ServletRequest, javax.servlet.ServletResponse, javax.servlet.FilterChain)

Method Detail

init

public void init(javax.servlet.FilterConfig config)
          throws javax.servlet.ServletException
Initializes the Filter by getting the list of subs and reading top user and given user information. A sub is just a copy of the nabu realm backed by distinct vocabularies. Every directory beneath /WEB-INF/subs implicates a sub, except hidden folders and folders with name admin. This directory is the uploadvocs location for the sub. A top user has "root" access to the main nabu and every sub. Top users are specified by the init param topUsers as a comma separated list, as pht,johi. A "given user" is not authenticated via LDAP/UniAccess. Instead a "given user" is specified by a init param with name user.<username>. The password is given by the value as an a MD5 hash (see hashPassword(String)).

Specified by:
init in interface javax.servlet.Filter
Parameters:
config - the filter configuration.
Throws:
javax.servlet.ServletException
See Also:
Filter.init(javax.servlet.FilterConfig)

doFilter

public void doFilter(javax.servlet.ServletRequest _request,
                     javax.servlet.ServletResponse _response,
                     javax.servlet.FilterChain chain)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     javax.servlet.ServletException
Filters the request. First if it is the first request, infers the correct SSL-Port by using ServletRequest.getServerPort() and ServletRequest.isSecure(). Then it analyzes the path to get the sub. The appropriate HttpCentral and $sub path is added to the request attributes. If administrative (/admin/*) tasks are adressed, the url gets normalized to https://<server>:securePort/nabu/admin/$sub/.... Then Basic HTTP authentication is required. The resulting username is authenticated as a "given user" or via LDAP/UniAccess bind. Finally the user is authorized either as a "top user" or by using the ACL information in the corresponding sub. The request is redirected to the plain jsp or servlet.

Specified by:
doFilter in interface javax.servlet.Filter
Parameters:
request - servlet request
response - servlet response
Throws:
java.io.IOException
javax.servlet.ServletException
